content.raw:
I am closing this PR until I have some tests written. Migrating to `argparse` in `load_genomedata.py` while maintaining the same interface has been infuriating.

I don't suppose you're interested in changing the interface. It would be a lot easier to do:

```bash

genomedata-load --seqfile [sizes | agp]
# instead of
genomedata-load [--sizes | --agp]

# and 

genomedata-load --mode [file | dir]
# instead of
genomedata-load [--file-mode | --dir-mode]
```
The defaults are easier to deal with in the proposed solution and argparse can provide `choices` very nicely in the help and usage messages. I think it would also be straightfoward to deprecate the old interface.
